sentence.Network_en: The Prime Minister was in ebullient mood.
He was ebullient over the reception of his novel.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因小说获好评而兴高采烈.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'boiling'): from Latin ebullient- 'boiling up', from the verb ebullire, from e- (variant of ex-) 'out' + bullire 'to boil'

entry.tran: 兴高采烈的;热情洋溢的
entry.def: If you describe someone as ebullient, you mean that they are lively and full of enthusiasm or excitement about something.

example.tran: 热情洋溢的俄罗斯总统
